titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Alfred E. Cohn papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA802 FA802
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Carolyn Kopp

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-08-27 02:57:48 -0400.

revisiondesc.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Alfred E. Cohn papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Physician, humanist, and author. One of first physicians in the United States to make electrocardiograms (Mount Sinai Hospital, New York City, 1910). Clinical researcher at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York City, 1911-1957.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical material, professional and personal correspondence, family letters, board and committee records, manuscripts of scientific and popular writings, notes, photographs, printed materials. Primarily correspondence and writings about heart disease including on aging, arteriosclerosis, digitalis, electrocardiography, hypertension, statistics, World War I cardiac neuroses. Also extensive material on social issues including émigré and refugee physicians and scholars from Europe; medicine in China; Blacks in medicine; graduate and medical education; post-World War II organization of science; psychiatry and psychoanalysis; Alger Hiss case. Correspondents include: Charles A. Beard (1874-1948), Samuel Nathaniel Behrman (1893-1973), Bernard Berenson (1865-1959), Carl Binger (1889-1968), Niels Bohr (1885-1962), Maurice Bowra (1898-1971), Louis D. Brandeis (1856-1941), Alexis Carrel (1873-1944), Harvey Cushing (1869-1939), Arthur W.M. Ellis (1883-1966), John Erskine (1979-1951), Abraham Flexner (1866-1959), Bernard Flexner (1865-1945), Simon Flexner (1863-1946), Felix Frankfurter (1882-1965), Francis Fraser (1885-1964), Herbert Spencer Gasser (1888-1963), Alan Gregg (1890-1957), William Ivins (1881-1961), Henry James (1879-1947), Smith Ely Jelliffe (1866-1945), Lawrence S. Kubie (1896-1973), Karl Landsteiner (1868-1943), Harold Laski (1893-1950), Thomas Lewis (1881-1945), Franklin C. McLean (1888-1968), James Mackenzie (1853-1925), Archibald MacLeish (1892-1982), Henry Alexander Murray, Jr. (1893-), Edward R. Murrow (1908-1975), George Canby Robinson (1878-1960), Charles Singer (1876-1960), Jean Stafford (1915-1979), Mark Van Doren (1894-1972), Hermann Weyl (1885-1955), Paul Dudley White (1886-1973), Alfred N. Whitehead (1861-1947).

Organizational records include: American Society for Clinical Investigation, 1922-1956; Asia Institute, 1940-1952; China Medical Board, 1927-1953; Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced German Scholars, 1933-1944; Institute for Psychoanalysis, 1932-1944; Joint Distribution Committee, 1921-1945; Journal of Clinical Investigation, 1923-1938; New School for Social Research, 1940-1952; Office of Foreign Relief, 1942-1944; Student Service of America, 1941-1948; Sydenham Hospital, 1947-1948; Veterans Bureau, 1924-1947; World's Fair, New York City, 1939.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for scholarly research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 1 Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains in original storage cartons.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: FA132 Alfred E. Cohn papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

did.unittitle: Alfred E. Cohn papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Level 1 Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original storage cartons.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The papers were found in considerable disorder, and the order below was given to aid retrieval of particular files/items. The group appears to be essentially an "E" correspondence file, but is not simply an omission from the correspondence already processed: there are an unusual number of family letters, as well as a number of items pre-1920, which distinguish this from the other correspondence.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The following files, continued in Paige box 28, are a special group of papers that were received in April 1982 from Dr. John Crow (New York Hospital); Dr. and Mrs. Crow bought the former Cohn residence in New Milford, Ct., in the fall of 1981. The papers were discovered in the attic of the guest house; for further background see the Archivist's administrative file on the Cohn Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Most of these papers were in unlabeled folders, with no clear indication of the internal order. The manuscript drafts have been put in chronological order insofar as possible; undated manuscripts are in alphabetical order by the first line of text. A few miscellaneous notes and loose pages are filed at the end of the series, as are a group of papers found in a stationery box labeled "Discarded sheets"].

did.unittitle: Laski, Harold J., Comment on book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This file was found in good order, though reports for some years/periods are missing. The series comprises primarily drafts by Cohn of reports to The Rockefeller Institute Board of Scientific Directors (April report) and to the Board of Trustees (October report) (other months, from the earliest years, are to the Bd. Sci. Dirs.). Also extant are a number of shorter reports prepared by Cohn's associates, which were incorporated by Cohn into the final version; some show Cohn's editorial revisions. In addition to these manuscript drafts, three soft-paper notebooks were found, containing the final reports for the years, respectively, April 1921-October 1925, April 1926-April 1930, and April 1931-March 1935. These reports have been removed from the notebooks and are filed at the beginning, of the period covered. Carolyn Kopp, 1 August 1985.
